page.title: 07Law and Order
page.content:
The limited resident population of the Hawkshead area causes little trouble, and law & order are to a large extent self-imposed. There is a police station with 2 cells, and a small magistrates court which sits on the 1st and 3rd Fridays of each month. There are 6 magistrates on rota. During the summer there is 1 sergeant with 6 constables on the station strength; in winter this is reduced to the sergeant and 3 constables. Their main problem is traffic, and theft from vehicles during the summer. In 1984 there were 189 crimes reported and 104 prisoners held. 303 other incidents were also reported.
Despite having a car park for 800 cars and 12 coaches, parking can be difficult in summer when the car park can often be full by 11 a.m.
